intro: Monanthes niphophila, commonly known as the snow ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, white, ghost-like flowers that bloom in the cold, mountainous environments. The plant has a short, compact growth habit and is adapted to survive in harsh, low-nutrient soils. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Monanthes niphophila is considered endangered and is often difficult to study in the wild.
